climbs.name: Snake Hipped Mistress
climbs.fa: Equip  Larry Shaffer. FA  Chris Hirsch & Tony Schwartz, 2014. FFA  Chris Hirsch, belayed by Taylor Lais, 9/2015

content.description: A wildly exposed arete that Shaffer regrets not finishing. He had 95% of the route complete. Tony and I were able to finish the route without adding any bolts. This line is hard right off the belay, especially gaining the fourth bolt (bad fall potential). After the fifth, go left around corner into crack. Place some gear then three bolts lead to the redpoint crux. Find a small RP placement and exit right to the anchors.
content.protection: 8 bolts   Small rack, Nuts/RPs, micro cams up to .5   Bolted anchor w/ webbing.
content.location: W side of spire. Climbs the arete/dyke. To get to belay, climb Devious Nature first then scramble over. Rap down chimney to the SW, 70m rope. Scramble back to Devious Nature's rap.

content.description: Another excellent line to add to the 4/5 gully ticklist. Start in left crack and make the balancy transition into the lieback crack to the right. Gear is hard to place in the beginning. Keep it together for the crux at the end. Stay left, aiming for the webbing belay/rap anchor.
content.protection: Doubles .5 to #3   Singles below .5   Nuts   Webbing with quicklinks for anchor
content.location: This crack is on the small wall down and right of Broken Point. 60m rope.

content.description: Tall and obvious spire of the 4/5 gully. First ascended by the Conns and Jack Ernst on Aug. 20th, 1953.
